titlestmt.titleproper: Stroud Foundation and Research Center records 1967-1982
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Stroud Foundation and Research Center records

bioghist.p: The Stroud Water Research Center is a research and education institution dedicated to the study of streams and rivers. Founded in 1966 as a field station of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, the Center became an independent, non-profit institution in 1999. The Center is located on the East Branch of White Clay Creek near Avondale, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of documents related to the Academy's involvement with the Stroud Water Research Center. Materials include a copy of a 1970 ecological survey entitled "Flora and Fauna of White Clay Creek and Valley, Preliminary Survey" compiled by Dorothy P. Miller; a lease agreement for property in Chester County, Pennsylvania between the Academy of Natural Science Philadelphia and the Stroud Foundation; and a letter from auditors about the Stroud Research Center's accounting methods.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
